etymologies: early 20th century. From the name of Roger Adams, U.S. chemist, who apparently isolated the compound in 1918 + -ite

definitions: An organic arsenic compound which induces vomiting and is irritating to the eyes and lungs, used in the form of an aerosol in chemical warfare, riot control, etc.; also called DM (diphenylaminechlorasine).

notes.text: Adamsite is a tricyclic compound. Systematic name: dibenzo-1-chloro-1,4-arsenine; C₁₂H₉AsClN.
